main event: On 15 March 1949, a witness in Morgantown, West Virginia observed a round flat object resembling the cover of a garbage can moving across the sky at a terrific speed.
interesting points: The object was described as yellowish in color, comparable to the moon., The object was estimated to be 15 inches in diameter and seen at a distance of about 20 miles., It left a yellowish, tapering trail estimated to be 20 to 30 feet long., The object made a sound similar to a sky rocket reaching the peak of a climb., Witness reported that the sky was clear with stars and the moon visible at the time of the sighting.
witness description: A resident of Morgantown, engaged in the real estate business.
